title: East Anglian holiday
creator_credit: British Transport Films, Edgar H. Anstey, Ian Ferguson and Michael Clarke
brief_description: Describes the beauty and historical associations of the East Anglia district of England. Mentions the open country of Norfolk as being a delight of gardeners and naturalists; and the lushness of Suffolk made famous by Constable. Includes shots of the “Broads”, home of sails, windmills and quiet waterways, Flatford and Horstead Mills and the old town of King’s Lynn. Narrated by Frank Duncan and Richard George.
